Detailed Description

The Visualizer class enables application to retrieve part of the currently playing audio for visualization purpose.

It is not an audio recording interface and only returns partial and low quality audio content. However, to protect privacy of certain audio data (e.g voice mail) the use of the visualizer requires the permission permission.RECORD_AUDIO.

enum gaia::media::Visualizer::ErrorCode

Error code of a Visualizer object returned.

Enumerator:
VISUALIZER_SUCCESS 

Successful operation.

VISUALIZER_ERROR 

Unspecified error.

VISUALIZER_ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS 

Internal operation status.

Not returned by any method.

VISUALIZER_ERROR_NO_INIT 

Operation failed due to bad object initialization.

VISUALIZER_ERROR_BAD_VALUE 

Operation failed due to bad parameter value.

VISUALIZER_ERROR_INVALID_OPERATION 

Operation failed because it was requested in wrong state.

VISUALIZER_ERROR_NO_MEMORY 

Operation failed due to lack of memory.

VISUALIZER_ERROR_DEAD_OBJECT 

Operation failed due to dead remote object.

enum gaia::media::Visualizer::InitialMode

The initial state of visualizer instance.

Enumerator:
STATE_UNINITIALIZED 

State of a Visualizer object that was not successfully initialized upon creation.

STATE_INITIALIZED 

State of a Visualizer object that is ready to be used.

STATE_ENABLED 

State of a Visualizer object that is active.

ErrorCode gaia::media::Visualizer::getFft ( base::ByteArray *  fft)

Returns a frequency capture of currently playing audio content.

This method must be called when the Visualizer is enabled. The capture is an 8-bit magnitude FFT, the frequency range covered being 0 (DC) to half of the sampling rate returned by getSamplingRate. The capture returns the real and imaginary parts of a number of frequency points equal to half of the capture size plus one.

Parameters:
fftarray of bytes where the FFT should be returned
Returns:
in case of success, return VISUALIZER_SUCCESS else return error See ErrorCode
int32_t gaia::media::Visualizer::getMaxCaptureRate ( )

Returns the maximum capture rate for the callback capture method.

Returns:
the maximum capture rate expressed in milliHertz

int32_t gaia::media::Visualizer::getSamplingRate ( )

Returns the sampling rate of the captured audio.

Returns:
the sampling rate in milliHertz.
ErrorCode gaia::media::Visualizer::getWaveForm ( base::ByteArray *  waveform)

Returns a waveform capture of currently playing audio content.

The capture consists in a number of consecutive 8-bit (unsigned) mono PCM samples equal to the capture size returned by getCaptureSize This method must be called when the Visualizer is enabled.

Parameters:
waveformarray of bytes where the waveform should be returned
Returns:
in case of success, return VISUALIZER_SUCCESS else return error See ErrorCode

ErrorCode gaia::media::Visualizer::setDataCaptureListener ( IVisualizerListener *  listener,
int32_t  rate,
bool  waveform,
bool  fft 
)

Registers an OnDataCaptureListener interface and specifies the rate at which the capture should be updated as well as the type of capture requested.

Call this method with a null listener to stop receiving the capture updates.

Parameters:
listenerOnDataCaptureListener registered
raterate in milliHertz at which the capture should be updated
waveformtrue if a waveform capture is requested: the onWaveFormDataCapture() method will be called on the OnDataCaptureListener interface.
ffttrue if a frequency capture is requested: the onFftDataCapture() method will be called on the OnDataCaptureListener interface.
Returns:
in case of success, return VISUALIZER_SUCCESS else return error See ErrorCode

Enable or disable the visualization engine.

Parameters:
enabledrequested enable state
Returns:
in case of success, return VISUALIZER_SUCCESS else return error See ErrorCode
